alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Alamosa, west central Costilla and east central Conejos Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along portions of south central Alamosa, west central Costilla and east central Conejos Counties through 600 PM MDT, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Alamosa, west central Costilla and east central Conejos Counties. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley
